actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1234.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Bice moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1234 â€” "To direct the Librarian of Congress to promote the more cost-effective, efficient, and expanded availability of the Annotated Constitution and pocket-part supplements by replacing the hardbound versions with digital versions."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 31.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House resumed with one minute speeches.

The House received a message from the Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Clerk notified the House that he had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on March 31, 2025, at 12:58 p.m.: That the Senate passed S.J. Res. 18 and agreed to S. Res. 148.

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification stating that the national emergency declared in Executive Order 13664 of April 3, 2014, with respect to South Sudan is to continue in effect beyond April 3, 2025
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 119-34).

The House received a message from the Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Clerk notified the House that he had received a sealed envelope from the White House on March 28, 2025, at 1:20 p.m., said to contain a message from the President on the Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to South Sudan.

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification stating that the national emergency declared in Executive Order 13694 of April 1, 2015, regarding significant malicious cyber-related activities originating outside the United States, and with respect to which additional steps were taken in Executive Order 13757 of December 28, 2016, Executive Order 13984 of January 19, 2021, Executive Order 14110 of October 30, 2023 (revoked by Executive Order 14148 of January 20, 2025), and Executive Order 14144 of January 16, 2025, is to continue in effect beyond April 1, 2025.
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 119-33).

The House received a message from the Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Clerk notified the House that he had received a sealed envelope from the White House on March 27, 2025, at 3:16 p.m., said to contain a message from the President on the Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to Significant Malicious Cyber-Enabled Activities.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Bean of FL to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 31.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable David J. Taylor to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
